Trust in the Lord with all your heart. – Proverbs 3:5
I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me. – Philippians 4:13
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. – Psalm 23:1
Be strong and courageous. – Joshua 1:9
Love your neighbor as yourself. – Matthew 22:39
Rejoice in the Lord always. – Philippians 4:4
Commit your work to the Lord, and your plans will be established. – Proverbs 16:3
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God. – Matthew 5:8
Seek first the kingdom of God. – Matthew 6:33
Do not fear, for I am with you. – Isaiah 41:10
The joy of the Lord is your strength. – Nehemiah 8:10
Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you. – 1 Peter 5:7
Let all that you do be done in love. – 1 Corinthians 16:14
For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also. – Matthew 6:21
I am the way, the truth, and the life. – John 14:6
Ask, and it will be given to you. – Matthew 7:7
The Lord is near to all who call on him. – Psalm 145:18
Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil. – Psalm 23:4
Let your light shine before others. – Matthew 5:16
Be still, and know that I am God. – Psalm 46:10
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path. – Psalm 119:105
Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. – James 4:8
He gives power to the faint, and to him who has no might he increases strength. – Isaiah 40:29
The Lord is good to those who wait for him. – Lamentations 3:25
Create in me a clean heart, O God. – Psalm 51:10
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. – Psalm 46:1
A friend loves at all times. – Proverbs 17:17
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. – Romans 12:21
Let us love, not in word or speech, but in truth and action. – 1 John 3:18
For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord. – Jeremiah 29:11
He who began a good work in you will bring it to completion. – Philippians 1:6
Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. – Galatians 6:2
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? – Psalm 27:1
Forgive, and you will be forgiven. – Luke 6:37
Walk by faith, not by sight. – 2 Corinthians 5:7
Therefore encourage one another and build one another up. – 1 Thessalonians 5:11
Give thanks in all circumstances. – 1 Thessalonians 5:18
My grace is sufficient for you. – 2 Corinthians 12:9
Pray without ceasing. – 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Taste and see that the Lord is good. – Psalm 34:8
Those who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength. – Isaiah 40:31
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord. – Psalm 150:6
He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds. – Psalm 147:3
The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still. – Exodus 14:14
God is love. – 1 John 4:8
The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace... – Galatians 5:22
Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another. – Ephesians 4:32
Blessed are the peacemakers. – Matthew 5:9
Do not worry about tomorrow. – Matthew 6:34
He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty. – Psalm 91:1
I will praise you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. – Psalm 139:14
Whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved. – Romans 10:13
Set your minds on things that are above. – Colossians 3:2
God is our refuge and strength. – Psalm 46:1
The Lord bless you and keep you. – Numbers 6:24
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. – John 14:27
Let us run with endurance the race that is set before us. – Hebrews 12:1
Honor your father and mother. – Exodus 20:12
Be humble and gentle. – Ephesians 4:2
The Lord is gracious and merciful. – Psalm 103:8
Taste and see that the Lord is good. – Psalm 34:8
For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son. – John 3:16
He restores my soul. – Psalm 23:3
Trust in the Lord, and do good. – Psalm 37:3
A soft answer turns away wrath. – Proverbs 15:1
The righteous will live by faith. – Habakkuk 2:4
Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly. – 2 Corinthians 9:6
Be watchful, stand firm in the faith. – 1 Corinthians 16:13
I have loved you with an everlasting love. – Jeremiah 31:3
Taste and see that the Lord is good. – Psalm 34:8
He will cover you with his pinions. – Psalm 91:4
Love is patient, love is kind. – 1 Corinthians 13:4
Do not be anxious about anything. – Philippians 4:6
The Lord is near to the brokenhearted. – Psalm 34:18
Commit your way to the Lord; trust in him. – Psalm 37:5
Be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might. – Ephesians 6:10
The Lord upholds all who are falling. – Psalm 145:14
He gives wisdom to the wise. – Daniel 1:17
Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. – James 4:8
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness. – Matthew 5:6
Let not your hearts be troubled. – John 14:1
He who covers an offense seeks love. – Proverbs 17:9
In everything give thanks. – 1 Thessalonians 5:18
The Lord is righteous in all his ways. – Psalm 145:17
A joyful heart is good medicine. – Proverbs 17:22
The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases. – Lamentations 3:22
Behold, I am with you always. – Matthew 28:20
Your word I have hidden in my heart. – Psalm 119:11
Let love be genuine. – Romans 12:9
Whatever you do, work heartily for the Lord. – Colossians 3:23
He leads me beside still waters. – Psalm 23:2
For where two or three are gathered in my name, there am I among them. – Matthew 18:20
The Lord is good; his steadfast love endures forever. – Psalm 100:5
Hope does not put us to shame. – Romans 5:5
Be transformed by the renewal of your mind. – Romans 12:2

Teach us to number our days that we may get a heart of wisdom. – Psalm 90:12
He will make a way in the wilderness. – Isaiah 43:19
The Lord delights in those who fear him. – Psalm 147:11
He remembers his covenant forever. – Psalm 105:8
God is light; in him there is no darkness at all. – 1 John 1:5
Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for. – Hebrews 11:1
Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord. – Jeremiah 17:7
